name: Arugula Salad With Peaches, Goat Cheese and Basil
description: This simple, quintessential summer salad is a reminder that seasonal ingredients at their very best don’t need much fussing (or much cooking at all, in this case). Here, peppery arugula and earthy goat cheese get brightened with juicy summer peaches, but the recipe can be tweaked to suit all seasons: If you can’t find ripe peaches, you can use cherries, strawberries, plums, raspberries or even cherry tomatoes in their place.
recipeCategory: brunch, dinner, easy, lunch, weekday, salads and dressings
keywords: appetizer, main course, side dish, arugula, basil, champagne vinegar, goat cheese, peach, pine nuts, summer
recipeIngredient: 2 tablespoons champagne vinegar or white wine vinegar
2 ripe peaches, pitted and cut into 1/4-inch slices (about 10 ounces)
2 ounces creamy goat cheese, crumbled (about ½ cup), plus more to taste

recipeInstructions.text: In a small sauté pan, toast the pine nuts over medium heat, tossing often, until golden brown, about 3 minutes. Remove from the heat.
In a small liquid measuring cup or bowl, whisk together the olive oil, vinegar, salt and pepper.

Place the arugula in a large salad bowl. Pour just enough dressing over the greens to moisten, and toss to coat. Add the peaches, basil, goat cheese and toasted pine nuts and toss to coat. Add more goat cheese and dressing if desired. Toss gently and serve immediately.
